conclusion: Two particles, A and B, start moving from rest in the same direction on a horizontal plane.
The v-t graph shows two lines, one for particle A and one for particle B.
Particle A's velocity increases to 2v0 at time t0 and then decreases to 0 at time 3t0.
Particle B's velocity increases to v0 at time 3t0 and then decreases to 0 at time 6t0.
The acceleration of particle A during its acceleration phase is calculated using the slope of its v-t graph from 0 to t0.
The acceleration of particle B during its acceleration phase is calculated using the slope of its v-t graph from 0 to 3t0.
The ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for A and B is determined by comparing the slopes of their respective v-t graph segments during acceleration.
